document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan Ž. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.masterDocTitle: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

heading.emphasis:
Caucasominorus billi
gen. et sp. nov.

Posterior view. cp = coxal process; cv = coxal vesicle; ll = lateral lamella; ml = mesal lamella; pl = posterior lamella; rs = row of setae; ss = sternal sac; ws = wing-like structure; ppr = posterior projection; sls = setae-like structure.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Differs from the only other known congener by the presence of numerous striae on the shields of the anterior gonopods, and of one or two knife-like lobes on the coxal processes of the posterior gonopods.
Etymology. The new species is named after Dr. William (Bill) Shear, a prominent diplopodologist who has made invaluable contributions to Chordeumatida systematics.

Material studied (total: 47 males , 85 females , 10 juvenile ).
Holotype .

3–4 May 1983

FIGURE 44.
Caucasominorus billi
gen. et sp. nov. , male from Agartsyn, Dilizhan Nature Reserve, Armenia. A. Pleurotergite 16, posterior view. B. Pleurotergite 15, dorsal view. C. Prozonite 15, dorsal view. D. Lateral keel 15, dorsal view. E. Posterior gonopods, anterior view. F. Posterior gonopods, lateral view. G. Posterior gonopods, posterior view. H. Posterior gonopods, lateral view. c = coxite; t = telopodite; b1 = knife-like branch; b2 = posteriorly curved branch; cv = coxal vesicle; sto = subtriangular tooth.

FIGURE 45.
Caucasominorus billi
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male. A. Leg 3. B. Leg 7. C. Leg 4. D. Leg 11. Scale lines = 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body with 31 segments (including telson) in adults.
MEASUREMENTS. Males 8.5–9.5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.7 mm . Females 9–12 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.8–0.9 mm .
HEAD . Slightly concave in males. Labrum with three medial teeth and 5+5 labral and 2+2 supralabral setae.

Promentum triangular, without setae. Lingual plates with 8+5 setae, on each plate arranged in two irregular rows in paratype male. Stipites with ca 20+20 setae. Antennae 1.4 mm long in paratype male. Length of antennomeres (in mm): I (0.06), II (0.16), III (0.37), IV (0.2), V (0.34), VI (0.15), VII (0.11) and VIII (0.01). Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I–VII: I (1), II (2), III (4), IV (2.5), V (2.6), VI (1.3) and VII (1.1). Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum, respectively. Number of ocelli 17–18, arranged in 5 rows in males; 16–20 in 5–6 rows in females.
COLLUM. Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior edge semi-circular, posterior margin gently concave.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 47.
Caucasominorus billi
gen. et sp. nov. , male from Agartsyn, Dilizhan Nature Reserve, Armenia, anterior gonopods. A. Anterior view. B. Anterolateral view. C. Lateral view. D. Posterolateral view. E. and F. Posterior view. cp = coxal process; cv = coxal vesicle; ll = lateral lamella; ml = mesal lamella; pl = posterior lamella; rs = row of setae; ss = sternal sac; ws = wing-like structure; ppr = posterior projection; sls = setae-like structure.

subSubSection.paragraph: BODY SEGMENTS ( Figs 43 , 44 A–D). Lateral keels like lateral swellings. Macrochaetae relatively long and trichoid. CIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.9; MIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 2.5; PIX (pleurotergite 15) ~0.5; MA (pleurotergite 15) ~ 110˚.
TELSON. Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and 3+3 setae (1+1 paramedian, 2+2 marginal). Hypoproct with 1+1 apical setae. Paraprocts with 3+3 marginal setae.
WALKING LEGS . In both sexes, leg-pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae; femora and postfemora with a group of several long and robust setae.

MALE SEXUAL CHARACTERS ( Fig. 45 ). Leg-pairs 3–7 enlarged. Leg-pairs 3 and 4 each with a basal exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 5 with a basal oral protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 6 without peculiarities. Legpair 7 with a posterior coxal horn. Leg-pair 10 with coxal glands and with an inner, coxal, rounded protrusion. Legpair 11 with coxal glands and a posterior coxal horn.

Distribution. Armenia ,
Azerbaijan
( Fig. 167 , red triangle).
